name: The Old Stables

reviews.text: Not normally one to write reviews but after reading the comments from bandit7 I felt I really had to! The Old Stables has to be one of the most stylish B&B's I've ever seen but I guess if your looking for the traditional Eastbourne style B&B owned by a little old lady who serves tea and greasy breakfast and locks the door at 10pm sharp then it's not for you!
reviews.title: A gem of a place, by far the most sylish B&B I've seen!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This B&B is located right in the heart of St.Margarets with easy access to both Twickenham and Richmond. It's decor is very stylish/contemporary and all fittings are pretty high spec. In terms of self service, yes it is but thats one of the bonuses of the place. The doors are operated on a keypad panel so you need a code which your'e given and your'e left to your own devices without interuptions from any landladys/lords. You can come and go as you please with no time restrictions etc. You will not get a greasy breakfast served and this is made clear on their literature, instead you have your own fridge/kettle/toaster - tea & coffee etc.
reviews.title: Great B&B, Great Location, Comfy & Good Value for money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To sum up this is a little hidden gem and far exceeds my expectations of a B&B. I live locally and have used it several times to put friends and family up and would have no hesitation in reccomending it to anyone.
reviews.title: Needs to be mucked out!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3rd time I’ve stayed and this time booked all 4 rooms. You have to book the studio it's great but watch out for the steps. It’s worth the extra for the roof terrace.
reviews.title: What a weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Modern, clean, On-Your-Own B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You need specific instructions to find this lovely B&B. It is right behind the main street of St. Margarets, and it is very quiet and only a one-block walk to stores and restaurants. There is no innkeeper on the premises but Jenny, the manager, was easy to reach. A nice supply of breakfast food and snacks is included. The Studio was spacious by European standards though the shower has a very narrow entry. The kitchen was ample for a Studio apartment. There are some smaller units in the building; but there is no dining or common area. We enjoyed the privacy of this arrangement.
reviews.title: Well Done

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location, Great rooms and Great Price. No need to say anything more.
reviews.title: Stylish, comfortable and a great location!

reviews.text: We loved this B and B with the self-service breakfast. The rooms are cute and stylish (a little small but every inch is utilized). We liked staying a little out of London and it was easy to take the train straight to downtown. Good value!
reviews.title: Bloody Fabulous!

reviews.text: My husband spent most of the first 48 years of his life in St Margarets, so I thought this was an ideal location to spend his 60th birthday. He was not disappointed. We had the studio for 2 adults and a child, and while it was not big (unlike the TV!) it was furnished to a very high standard, clean and comfortable. The beds were extremely comfortable. Breakfast was provided - great to arrive to a fridge containing milk. 5 minutes walk from the railway station with 4 trains an hour to Waterloo, 5 minutes from Marble Hill park and 10 minutes walk from Richmond. I was able to contact Jenny by phone whenever necessary and always received a quick response.
reviews.title: Excellent location and a really comfortable bed

reviews.text: I wouldn't hesitate in recommending the Old Stables - it's very well maintained, efficiently managed and spotlessly clean. It's a lovely location tucked away behind Crown Road in villagey St Margarets. I don't agree with the reviewer who stayed there in August 2008 - Jenny and her team do an excellent job of making sure that the very highest standards are maintained.
reviews.title: A Village Feel

reviews.text: This really is a great place to stay. I would recommend to anyone who likes the idea of a very comfortable room with a quality finish. The keypad access to the room was great for me as i could arrive and depart as early as i like. The only drawback would be the footstep noises from upstairs. The kitchen in a cupboard was convienient and provided continental breakfast (toast / cereal / yoghurt). This was plenty and if you were on a budget i think you could have had these for dinner too! I've stayed in plenty of hotels for business and what makes this stand out is the quality of the items they leave for you to eat / drink and use. Honestly, if you had forgot all your toiletries then this place had the lot ! The tube is a one minute walk away and everyone was quite friendly. I'd stay again in the future.
reviews.title: Oustanding Quality B&B - It's better than a hotel.

reviews.text: I stayed at The Old Stable on a trip to London. It is by far the best Band B experience I have ever had no landlady to answer to, great fresh breakfast to eat at my leisure, freedom to come and go as I pleased. The decor is really stylish no chinz. The room and en-suit bathroom were both spotless, bedlinen and towels both fresh and beautifully pressed.
reviews.title: Best B and B

reviews.text: I have stayed at the Old Stables several times, January 09 being the most recent. The rooms are clean, bright, well appointed and fully equipped. The self service breakfast is a great idea, its convenient and caters for all pallets. I would recommend the Old Stables time and time again and will definitely be returning whenever I need a place to stay in the London area
reviews.title: A jewel of a place, convenient, accessible and great value

reviews.text: We stayed here for 1 week. The accommodation we had was 3 bedroom self catering, spacious and very comfortable. The accommodation we stayed in was equipped for a disabled person 1 Twin bedroom with bathroom downstairs, 1 Double and 1 Single bedroom and a bathroom upstairs. There is a farm store on site which sells local farm produce. Transport is required to explore the surrounding area- but if you just want to spend time in Salisbury you can take advantage of the Park and Ride at the end of the street. It does regular bus trips to the centre of Salisbury without having to worry about finding a car park.
reviews.title: Loved it. A wonderful place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our brother and family recommended this "bed and breakfast" as we wanted to stay in the St. Margaret's and Richmond area to be close to his home to make our visit easier. I use "bed and breakfast" lightly as it's more like renting an apartment that comes stocked with food for breakfast. For our needs, it was perfectly convenient as it was an easy walk to our brother's home. Down a cobble alleyway in the village center - all very quaint. The small building rents 4-5 (I think) apartments of various sizes. We rented one of the smaller ones - and it was quite small for two people - more like a hotel room. Nevertheless, the place was comfortable, homey and quiet. We loved it. Great bed - cozy and comfortable. Fantastic shower and spacious bathroom. And very quiet ....... we didn't hear or see of the other guests. On our last night, we walked to a delicious Indian take-out restaurant - literally two minutes from our place - and brought the food back to the place - and enjoyed the meal while watching while excellent bad British tv shows. There is no "service" as there is no "front desk" - nor did we meet the owners. But we were not looking for "hotel service" so it was not an issue for us.
reviews.title: Home away from home

reviews.text: We will absolutely stay there again the next time we visit our brother and his family.
reviews.title: Wot a Suprise

reviews.text: Difficult to find but deff worth looking for! We have just had a very pleasant Christmass with family in Richmond and used The Old Stables as our overnight base. it warm warm ,clean and we loved the selfserve breakfast. We had the twin bedded room and the beds were a little uncomfortable and the shower was not up to 4* standard. However we found the management happy to help with this problem even though it was boxing day. We would come again & would reccomend to others.
reviews.title: Fantastic BNB, great location and super facilities

reviews.text: I stayed at the Old Stables over a period of several weeks for business and thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The rooms are clean, modern and well appointed. I really like the keypad access and the secure parking is both reasonable and very handy. The location is great, near to lots of nice restaurants, bars and pubs and just round the corner from the train station.
reviews.title: Great Place to stay will definately stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had a really nice stay and I would like to thank the Managers for a lovely time.
reviews.title: Good quality accommodation in Richmond

description: The Old Stables is situated in a quiet street of St. Margarets. Our accommodation comprises of 3 well appointed ensuite bedrooms and 1 self contained studio apartment with fully equipped kitchen, ensuite. Families or groups can book the top floor to include the studio and the double (Room 3) for your own self contained area. Each room contains Iron + Ironing board, TV, Hairdryer, Breakfast served. Public telephone in main Hallway with free connection to manager. Free Wi.Fi .
